item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "Claim whatever you want. Say you only want a happy family or a successful career or a big house. I say: no, that's not what you want. You'll settle for those things, but you really want a monkey that does your evil bidding. Pullman is a genius just for this." -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "He thrusts his fists against the posts and still insists he sees the ghosts." -- Stephen King

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Henry Drummond
item.description: "you will find as you look back upon your life that the moments when you have truly lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love." -- Henry Drummond

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life is no brief candle to me. It is a sort of splendid torch which I have got a hold of for the moment, and I want to make it burn as brightly as possible before handing it on to future generations." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Winston Churchhill
item.description: "We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give." -- Winston Churchhill

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life has been your art. You have set yourself to music. Your days are your sonnets." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Grandma Moses
item.description: "And life is what we make it. Always has been, always will be." -- Grandma Moses

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "Life is ours to be spent, not to be saved." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by George Washington Carver
item.description: "How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these. " -- George Washington Carver

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by H. Jackson Brown
item.description: "Remember that everyone you meet is afraid of something, loves something and has lost something." -- H. Jackson Brown

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Kobi Yamada
item.description: "Sometimes you just have to take the leap and build your wings on the way down." -- Kobi Yamada

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Though I do not believe that a plant will spring up where no seed has been, I have great faith in a seed. Convince me that you have a seed there, and I am prepared to expect wonders." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Who has not found the heaven below Will fail of it above. God's residence is next to min, His furniture is love." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by E. Welty
item.description: "A good snapshot keeps a moment from running away." -- E. Welty

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "One day you will do things for me that you hate. That is what it means to be family." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I sustain myself with the love of family." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "All families are psychotic. Everybody has basically the same family - it's just reconfigured slightly different from one to the next." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "It's strange how pain marks our faces, and makes us look like family." -- Stephen King

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "The history of a city was like the history of a family—there is closeness and even affection, but death eventually separates everyone from each other. It is only the vividness of memory that keeps the dead alive forever; a writer’s job is to imagine everything so personally that the fiction is as vivid as our personal memories. " -- John Irving

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "There is no such thing as fun for the whole family." -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by ~Mary Oliver, "Wild Geese"
item.description: "Whoever you are, no matter how lonely, the world offers itself to your imagination, calls to you like the wild geese, harsh and exciting-over and over announcing your place in the family of things." -- ~Mary Oliver, "Wild Geese"

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Debra Gilbert Rosenberg
item.description: "New mothers enter the world of parenting feeling much like Alice in Wonderland. - Being a mother is one of the most rewarding jobs on earth and also one of the most challenging. - Motherhood is a process. Learn to love the process. - There is a tremendous amount of learning that takes place in the first year of your baby’s life; the baby learns a lot, too. - It is sometimes difficult to reconcile the fantasy of what you thuoght motherhood would be like, and what you thought you would be like as a mother, with reality. - Take care of yourself. If Mommy isn’t happy, no one else in the family is happy either. - New mother generally need to lower their expectations. - A good mother learns to love her child as he is and adjusts her mothering to suit her child." -- Debra Gilbert Rosenberg

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Nick Cave
item.description: "Samuel: What's a misanthrope? Two Bob: A misanthrope is a bugger who hates every other bugger. Samuel: Are we misanthropes? Arthur: Lord no! We're family. " -- Nick Cave

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Live in such a way that you would not be ashamed to sell your parrot to the town gossip." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Angela2932 add a quote by Anthony Brandt
item.description: "Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family." -- Anthony Brandt
